intro: Columbaria pratensis, commonly known as the meadow columbaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. Columbaria pratensis thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
